bool ready

Detailed Description

This class implements the class stTreeInfoResult. It works as a form that each tree must fill in order to provide its statistics to users.

Author:
Fabio Jun Takada Chino (chino@icmc.usp.br)

Marcos Rodrigues Vieira (mrvieira@icmc.usp.br)

Member Function Documentation

void stTreeInformation::Calculate (   )  [protected]
 

This method uses the information available to calculate the FatFactor.

Since this method is a quite expensive, the flag ready is used to avoid unnecessary calls to this method. To assure this, never call this method directly, call Validate() instead.

Referenced by Validate().

void stTreeInformation::CalculateOptimalTreeInfo (  int  occupation  ) 
 

This method calculates the optimal tree info based on the same rules used to calculate the best M-Tree and Slim-Tree configuration. It assumes that all objects are stored in the last level of the tree and the number of links in an internal node is equal to occupation.

Since not all trees follow these rules, a method called SetOptimalTreeInfo() may be used to fill the information about the optimal tree.

Parameters:
occupation The maximum occupation of a node.
See also:
SetOptimalTreeInfo()
Warning:
For tree use only.

virtual double stTreeInformation::GetAbsoluteFatFactor (   )  [inline, virtual]
 

Returns the absolute FatFactor for this tree. The result of this method is meanless if HasOptimalTree() returned false.

Implements stTreeInfoResult.

virtual double stTreeInformation::GetMeanObjectSize (   )  [inline, virtual]
 

Returns the mean size of the objects stored in the tree. This value is useful to help tree developers to calculate the optimal tree.

Implements stTreeInfoResult.

virtual void stTreeInformation::Invalidate (   )  [inline, virtual]
 

This method invalidates the current calculated FatFactor data. These data will be recalculated again when required.

Implements stTreeInfoResult.

void stTreeInformation::ResetData (   )  [protected]
 

Resets all data acquired from the tree. All fields are set to 0.

void stTreeInformation::SetOptimalTreeInfo (  int  height,
int *  objectCount,
int *  nodeCount
) 
 

Sets the information obout the optimal tree. This information is used to calculate some of the tree's statistics.

Parameters:
height The optimal height of the tree.
objectCount The number of objects per level in the optimal tree.
nodeCount The number of nodes per level of the optimal tree.
See also:
CalculateOptimalTreeInfo()
Warning:
For tree use only.

void stTreeInformation::UpdateMeanObjectSize (  stSize  size  )  [inline]
 

Updates the mean size of the object by adding a new object entry. To make this computation more accurate, avoid to add a given object more than once.

Parameters:
size Size of the serialized object in bytes.
Warning:
For tree use only.

void stTreeInformation::Validate (   )  [inline, protected]
 

Updates the FatFactor data when required. It must be called once before all FatFactor returning method to assure the consistency of data.

See also:
Invalidate()

bool stTreeInformation::ready [protected]
 

This flag is used to determine the availability of the FatFactor information. If this flag is false, it is necessary to call Calculate() to make the information ready to use.

See also:
Validate()

Invalidate()
